title: Wave properties - wave speed vs pulse amplitude

content.question: A wave generator can produce wave pulses of different amplitudes on a string that has a fixed amount of tension. A student claims that increasing the amplitude of the wave pulses will cause the speed at which the pulses propagate along the string to increase. Is the studentâ€™s claim correct? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes. Increasing the amplitude of a wave pulse increases the energy carried by the pulse.
Yes. Increasing the amplitude of a wave pulse causes points on the string to move a greater distance in the same amount of time.
No. The speed at which a wave pulse propagates along a string is independent of the amplitude of the wave.
No. The speed at which a wave pulse propagates along a string is inversely related to the amplitude of the wave.

content.answer: No. The speed at which a wave pulse propagates along a string is independent of the amplitude of the wave.
